definition: to give vent to anger

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
lit. to breathe through the same nostril (idiom); fig. two people say exactly the same thing (usually derog.)/to sing from the same hymn sheet
gas or air outlet/emotional outlet
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath

sentences.english: Methods By using the negative high voltage exhaled thoron progeny measurement system.
sentences.chinese: 方法采用负高压呼出气中子体测定装置。

sentences.english: I want to write an angry letter but I lost my nerve when I sat down to do it.
sentences.chinese: 我想写一封信出出气，但我坐下来写时又失去了勇气。

sentences.english: Sorry,I took it out on you.
He exclaimed, still excited, willing to be angry at anyone for the moment .
sentences.chinese: 他嚷道，还是急躁得很，一时很想找什么人出出气。

sentences.english: She's plain doormat, for even every member of her family would treat her like dirt.
sentences.chinese: 她简直就是个出气筒，连家里人都不把她当回事。

sentences.english: The stainless steel out\|gassing rates can be reduced greatly by high temperature degassing technology in a vacuum furnace.
sentences.chinese: 真空炉高温除气工艺可以大大降低不锈钢出气率。

sentences.english: The comparison between the values of spanwise variations of outlet angle with an inviscid secondary flow theory and those by measurement is approximated.
sentences.chinese: 二次流理论计算叶栅出气角沿叶高变化与实验相近。

sentences.english: The product is separated by distilation into gasoline and gas oil.
sentences.chinese: 这种产品是用蒸馏分离出气油和粗柴油。

sentences.english: Open the second sterile pouch and connect the tubing to the insufflator's gas outlet.
sentences.chinese: 打开第二个消毒袋，把管系连接到注气器出气口处。

sentences.english: She's very unhappy, so she often takes it out on her children.
sentences.chinese: 她很不开心，经常拿孩子出气。

sentences.english: Any indication of Outgassing on the glass is a failure.
sentences.chinese: 任何迹象出气对玻璃是一种失败。

sentences.english: Being another person’s emotional punching bag isn’t good for you and it isn’t good for them.
sentences.chinese: 成为他人的出气筒对你对他都没有好处。

sentences.english: As many people do when they are angry, the king wanted to blame someone else.
sentences.chinese: 向其他人一样，愤怒的王找一个人出出气。

sentences.english: What haudio-videoe the kids done to provoke you? Why should you take it out on them?
sentences.chinese: 孩子们没招你惹你的，你干吗拿他们当出气筒？

sentences.english: I know you are unsatisfied, but don't take it out on me.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你不满意，但是不要拿我当出气筒。

sentences.english: She was so angry at her husband that she took it out on her children.
sentences.chinese: 她因和丈夫生气，就拿孩子来作出气筒。

definition: to take one's revenge/to score off sb
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to take revenge/to avenge
to give vent to anger
to give vent to anger
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
evil smell/resentment/unpleasant manner
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to cool one's temper
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to be outraged by an injustice
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to pay with one's life
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to carry out a vendetta against sb
to look for trouble
